page.title: 03The School in Taddington
page.content: Our school began about 1714 when the Rev.Roger Wilkson left some land at Biggin for it. At first it was held in a barn at Priestcliffe.In 1847 a proper building was erected in Taddington and enlarged in 1926 when White's School was closed.It now has oil-fired central heating and its own kitchen unit.Though the school bell has gone its kennel remains on the infant classroom roof.We have a big field to play on as well as a hard surfaced playground but both slope. The school day is from 9 to 15.15 with an hour for dinner.The juniors go swimming once a week,and learn to play recorders and melodicas.We all do some woodwork and even the boys do some needlework.We have a computer.The leavers are always given dictionaries as parting presents.There are now only twenty pupils and two teachers.
